s.text: Only 15 of us are waiting inside the courthouse.
The Flytrap authorities are winning: The List entitles you to stand in the hall outside the third-floor grand jury room (everyone else must wait on the first floor).
Because no one knows where Monica will arrive, the cameras cover every line of sight to every courthouse door.
First, a critical question of interpretation: From my sense of her body language and tone, Monica was clearly checking to make sure the phone would not disturb the X-ray machine.
Every camera crew, TV correspondent, and newspaper reporter gathered on Pennsylvania Avenue knows, to a nearly perfect certainly, that we will report nothing of substance this morning.

This analysis is, of course, an absurd exercise, but no more absurd than anything else about today.

She is wearing a blue suit--not quite navy blue, but a bit closer to that notorious color than I would have chosen--and white pumps and is carrying a white purse.
The first question sufficed, but Monica felt so unsure that she asked the second question.
Monica asked these two questions to the marshal manning the X-ray machine at the courthouse door.
